info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 2:05AM CDT until March 24 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR EASTERN COKE...WEST CENTRAL COLEMAN...SOUTHEASTERN NOLAN... NORTHEASTERN TOM GREEN...SOUTHWESTERN TAYLOR AND RUNNELS COUNTIES... At 204 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Maverick, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Norton around 210 AM CDT. Hatchel around 220 AM CDT. Winters around 225 AM CDT. Crews around 235 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Lake Abilene, Drasco, Camp Tonkawa, Pumphrey, Shep, Wilmeth, Lake Winters Lake, Ballinger Lake, Oak Creek Reservoir and Ovalo. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from windows. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
